It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to the high-altitude environments of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Smithia abyssinica is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
